display_name: OP-TEE fTPM TA - REE-Triggered TA Panic (CVE-2025-46733 / GHSA-f35r-hm2m-p6c3)
description: The fTPM (firmware TPM) Trusted Application for OP-TEE. CVE-2025-46733: A malicious REE process replacing tee-supplicant can return unexpected error codes to Secure Storage API calls, triggering TA panics. Since fTPM uses TA_FLAG_SINGLE_INSTANCE and TA_FLAG_INSTANCE_KEEP_ALIVE, each panic followed by TA reload resets PCR values, allowing falsification of boot measurements and access to sealed data. The fix is in optee_os libutee (commit 941a58d78c99c4754fbd4ec3079ec9e1d596af8f) which sanitizes return codes before passing to TAs.
ground_truth_note: ground_truth.csv contains known vulnerable lines. Empty rows indicate manual annotation is required.
